==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}}: a snake. This is now written as the derivative {{och-l|蛇}}.

The character was later borrowed for the then-homophonous third-person pronoun (“he/she/it”). Today {{zh-l|他}} is used for male or gender-unspecified “he” and {{zh-l|她}} for “she”.
